result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D. Romaine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $150.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Fine and Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the Fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott D. Romaine

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:38 AM:  Defendant Scott D. Romaine in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Resolution reached and recited.  Def confirms agreement reached.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea (DC):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def: None offered.  The Court:  Accepts agreement reached and imposes $200 fine plus costs.  Costs to include DNA Surcharge.  Sample to be provided today.  Right to petition for expungement of DNA record thru DOJ explained.  Appeal Rights Given.

Pre-trial conference at 08-21-2015 03:00 pm.
Status conference at 09-01-2015 10:35 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:05 pm: Defendant Scott D. Romaine in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - states he is currently on disability and on a fixed income.  Def requests to speak with the State on his own on resolution.   Court accepts voluntary waiver of counsel today.   NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 10:35 am.
